anmaq: to remember, to commemorate, to have a remembrance ceremony for (the dead etc.)
artım: growth, increase, rise (in a quantity, price, etc.)
arxac: resting place for sheep or cattle out in the free during herding in the summer
asiya: Asia (the largest continent, located between Europe and the Pacific Ocean)
avand: successful, fruitful, accomplished (of plans, actions, activities)
avans: advance, imprest (amount of money, paid before it is due)
axsaq: lame, limping (unable to walk properly because of a problem with one's feet or legs)
ayrıc: crossroads, parting of the ways, fork in the road
azmaq: to lose one's way, to get lost
ağdaş: Agdash (a city and district of Azerbaijan)
ağıçı: wailer (a hired (professional) mourner, usually a woman)
balaq: lower part of a trouser leg
batqı: loss (the sum an entity loses on balance)
bağlı: bundle (package wrapped or tied up for carrying)
başaq: ear (fruiting body of a grain plant)
betər: more unfavorable; more negative; more good
bivec: no good, of no use, good-for-nothing (mostly of people)
biçin: harvest, harvesting (process of harvesting, gathering the ripened crop, harvest yield)
bölən: divisor (a number that another is to be divided by)
böyür: the part between the rib and the hip; the side, flank
bükmə: verbal noun of bükmək (“to wrap, to roll”)
bəlgə: gift sent to the household of the fiancée as a token of engagement (usually a ring and a headscarf)
bəyan: a male given name from Arabic
calaq: graft (small shoot or scion of a tree inserted in another tree)
camal: a male given name from Arabic
cavid: a male given name from Persian
ciyər: general name of lung and liver
culfa: Julfa (a city and district of Azerbaijan)
cığal: cheater, cheat, rook, one who cheats in card or board games (especially one who insists that s/he didn't cheat)
cəftə: bolt, bar, latch (for locking a door, window, etc.)
cəsim: large in scale, size, extent; bulky
dalan: dead end (street or path that goes nowhere or is blocked on one end)
damğa: cattle or horse brand (mark or scar made by burning)
daraq: a toothed implement for grooming the hair
dayaz: shoal (a shallow in a body of water)
didik: tattered, torn up into shreds or strands
dovğa: A traditional Azerbaijani yogurt-based soup made with herbs (such as dill, mint, and coriander), rice, and sometimes chickpeas; served hot or cold, often as a starter or during holidays.
duzaq: trap, snare (a device designed to catch animals)
düzən: plain (expanse of land with relatively low relief, usually exclusive of forests, deserts, and wastelands.)
düşük: preemie (a baby that has been born prematurely)
ehsan: meal given in the memory of a deceased person
faciə: a tragic drama or similar work
fazil: a male given name from Arabic
fəxri: a male given name from Arabic
gedər: third-person singular future indefinite of getmək
gilas: cherry, sweet cherry (fruit, tree, or wood) (Prunus avium)
girov: security (something that secures the fulfillment of an obligation)
güdük: a vantage point with a view of the surrounding area
gürcü: Georgian, a person from the country Georgia
güyüm: large copper jug with a neck and a handle for carrying on the shoulder
güzəm: wool shorn off the sheep in the autumn.
gələn: subject non-past participle of gəlmək (“to come”)
gərək: necessary, it is needed; have to
hafiz: a male given name from Arabic
halal: Permissible, according to Muslim religious customs; halal
hamar: smooth (having a texture that lacks friction, not rough)
hodaq: ox (an adult male of cattle used as a beast of burden)
hövzə: basin (a depression, natural or artificial, containing water)
hücrə: a small single-room building adjacent to a mosque or caravanserai; stone chamber
hüquq: right (a legal, just or moral entitlement)
hədəf: target (a butt or mark to shoot at, as for practice, or to test the accuracy of a firearm, or the force of a projectile)
hədər: in vain, vainly, to no avail
icarə: payment made for the use of equipment or a service
ilgək: loop (length of thread, line or rope, a shape produced by a curve)
iqrek: The name of the Latin script letter Y/y. (used in mathematical notation)
iradə: will (one's intention or decision; someone's orders or commands)
itmək: to get lost, be lost, vanish, disappear
işğal: occupation (control of a country or region by a hostile army)
kasıb: poor (with little or no possessions or money)
kefal: grey mullet (including Mugil and Liza spp.)
keçən: subject non-past participle of keçmək (“to pass”)
kimsə: someone; anyone (in negative sentences); someones, some people (when used in plural);
kiriş: bowstring made of sheep or goat guts
kirvə: a kind of godfather who holds a boy during his circumcision
kubok: cup (a trophy in the shape of an oversized cup)
kösöv: A piece of burning wood or peat, or a glowing cinder; brand
kötək: wooden rod, bludgeon, cudgel (used for beating)
kütlə: mass (a quantity of matter cohering together so as to make one body)
kəfən: shroud, winding sheet, wrapping of a dead
kəvər: caper (a plant of the genus Capparis)
latış: Latvian (a person from Latvia or of Latvian descent)
lavaş: lavash (a soft, thin flatbread made with flour, water, yeast, and salt, baked in a tandoor)
licim: (good) appearance, (good) looks, (good) shape, being neat and tidy
ləzgi: a Lezgi (member of an ethnic group living predominantly in southern Dagestan and northeastern Azerbaijan)
ləçək: petal (one of the component parts of the corolla of a flower)
manqa: team, squad (smallest unit in a hierarchy or sequence)
maraq: interest (a great attention and concern from someone or something; intellectual curiosity)
mesaj: message (an underlying theme or conclusion to be drawn from something)
meyar: criterion, yardstick (way in which something is measured)
murad: a male given name, Murad, from Arabic
mənim: genitive of mən (“I”, the first-person singular pronoun)
mətin: a male given name from Arabic
nakam: failed to achieve one's wishes, disappointed at life, unable to achieve happiness
natiq: orator (someone who orates or delivers an oration)
naxış: pattern (a design, motif or decoration, especially formed from regular repeated elements)
nazil: only used in nazil etmək (“to divinely reveal”) and nazil olmaq (“to be divinely revealed”)
nağıl: a folktale featuring fairies or similar fantasy characters
nüsxə: copy (printed edition of a book or magazine)
nəzir: a vow to make an oblation or donation to charity or a mosque (e.g. to recover from illness) or to do anything devout
olmaz: negative subject future indefinite participle of olmaq
ovdan: traditional underground water storage reservoir with a small stone structure above the surface
ovlaq: area for hunting, area abundant with game
ovsun: spell, incantation (a special sequence of words with a magic effect)
oxucu: reader (a person who reads a publication)
oynaq: joint (any part of the body where two bones join)
oğraş: one who is passive to or accepting of perceived sexual looseness of female relatives; cf. cuckold
padoş: sole (bottom of a shoe or boot)
polis: police (an organisation that enforces the law)
qapan: large scales (a device for measuring weight)
qarlı: snow-covered, snowbound, snowed up, covered with deep snow
qarış: palm of hand with outstretched fingers
qaxac: jerky, meat dried in the sun
qayın: brother-in-law, specifically, the brother of one's spouse
qayış: a band worn around the waist to hold clothing to one's body
qazax: Gazakh (a city and district of Azerbaijan)
qaçış: run (an act or instance of running)
qaşqa: white spot, white blaze on the forehead of an animals (e.g. a horse)
qolac: fathom (distance between each hand's fingers when the arms are stretched out sideways)
qonur: third-person singular present simple of qonmaq
qoçaq: a braveheart; a heart of oak
qusar: Qusar (a city and district of Azerbaijan)
qutab: a dish made from thinly rolled dough with greens or meat as fillings
qüvvə: strength or energy of body or mind
qədir: value (the degree of importance given to something)
qəliz: viscous (having a thick, sticky consistency between solid and liquid)
qələm: pen (a tool containing ink used to write or make marks)
qəmər: a female given name from Arabic
qəpik: qapik (a unit of currency equivalent to a hundredth of an Azerbaijani manat)
qəzəl: ghazal (a poetic form mostly used for love poetry in Middle Eastern, South, and Central Asian poetry)
rayon: district, rayon (second level subdivision unit ex-USSR countries).
rübai: rubai; a traditional quatrain in classical Arabic, Persian, Turkic or Urdu poetry.
rüsum: duty (tax; tariff; fee or payment to the state)
rəcəb: a male given name from Arabic
rəfiq: a male given name from Arabic
rəvac: vendible, in great demand, selling well
rəşid: a male given name from Arabic
sabit: A quantity that remains at a fixed value throughout a given discussion.
sağrı: croup (the top of the rump of a horse or other quadruped)
sekta: cult (a group, sect or movement following an unorthodox religious or philosophical system of beliefs)
siftə: beginning of some enterprise or endeavour
silgi: rag (piece of cloth for wiping dust)
sinif: school class (a group of students who commenced or completed their education during a particular year)
sovxa: belongings (e.g. clothing items) remaining after the death of the owner
subay: bachelor, bachelorette; unmarried person. (mostly of men)
sutka: 24 hours (of the clock), day, day and night, nychthemeron
sütun: pillar (solid upright structure designed usually to support a larger structure)
süzmə: verbal noun of süzmək (“to strain, to filter”)
səcdə: bowing down (till the forehead reaches the earth)
sətir: line, string, row (single horizontal row of text on a screen, printed paper, etc.)
səvab: a male given name from Arabic
tanış: acquaintance (a person or persons with whom one is acquainted)
taqət: strength or energy to do something
taraz: water level, spirit level, bubble level
taxça: niche (a recess (in a wall) where items can be stored)
taxıl: cereal (a type of grass (such as wheat, rice or oats) cultivated for its edible grains)
tağar: various units of weight mainly used to measure large quantities of grains
tiraj: print circulation (average number of copies of a publication)
tufan: storm, tempest characterized by substantial, heavy rainfall or snowfall
tutma: verbal noun of tutmaq (“to hold; to catch”)
töycü: kind of tax imposed on farmers
tümən: toman (a Persian money of account or gold coin issued until 1927)
təkyə: support (something which supports and prevents from falling)
təmim: a male given name from Arabic
təməl: that upon which anything is founded; that on which anything stands; the lowest and supporting layer of a superstructure
təyin: establishment (the act of proving and causing to be accepted as true; establishing a fact; demonstrating)
təzək: chip (a dried piece of dung used as fuel)
uymaq: to correspond, to conform, to agree, to comply, to be in line with, to fit
uzağı: at most, at the most, maximum, up to, at best, max (i.e., no more than)
vaqif: a male given name from Arabic
xalat: dressing gown, bathrobe (for men or women)
xalis: pure (free of foreign material or pollutants)
xaqan: title of imperial rank in Turkic and Mongolic languages, ruler of a khaganate; khagan.
xizək: sledge, sleigh, sled (a vehicle on runners, used for conveying loads over the snow or ice)
xonça: tray filled with different sweets, fruits and pastry
xunta: junta (ruling council of a military dictatorship, or the military dictatorship itself)
xüsus: regard, respect (only in with a demonstrative or interrogative and always in locative)
xələf: a person or thing that immediately follows another in holding an office or title
xəmsi: European anchovy, Azov anchovy (small saltwater fish)
xətib: khatib (a person who delivers the khutbah)
xəşil: thick porridge made of flour with butter, honey, sugar, etc.
yallı: a type of folk dance in Azerbaijan
yanaq: outside of cheek (soft part of a face)
yarus: circle (a curved upper tier of seats in a theater)
yatab: group of escorted or transported convicts, e.g. from one prison to another
yayla: plateau, tableland (a largely level expanse of land at a high elevation)
yengə: A woman who guides the bride and prepares her for the nuptial night, follows her to the bridegroom's house, and, upon the consummation of marriage, brings the sheets covered with blood stains back to the parents' house as a token of the bride's virginity; sometimes also functions as a matchmaker.
yerli: local (from or in a nearby location)
yeznə: brother-in-law, specifically, the husband of one's sister
yolka: Christmas tree (in Azerbaijan used for New Year's)
yumaq: yarn ball, clew (of thread), ball of wool
yusif: a male given name from Arabic in turn from Hebrew, equivalent to English Joseph
yığma: verbal noun of yığmaq (“to gather, collect”)
yığım: set, kit, outfit, collection (collection of various objects for a particular purpose, such as a set of tools)
zahir: a male given name from Arabic
zamin: guarantor, voucher (one who or that which vouches)
zehin: memory (ability to retain information about past).
zehni: intellectual (pertaining to, or performed by, the intellect; mental or cognitive)
zənci: black person of African descent, Negro
çeşid: sort, kind, variety (of goods and items)
çiyan: scolopendra (a centipede of the genus Scolopendra).
çolaq: lame, limping (unable to walk properly because of a problem with one's feet or legs)
çomaq: a herdsman's staff or stick with a round head
çovuş: crier (an officer who proclaims the orders or directions of a court, or who gives public notice by loud proclamation, such as a town crier.)
çərçi: peddler (an itinerant seller of small goods)
örkən: girth (band or strap passed under an animal to hold a saddle in place)
örtük: blanket, bedspread or any other piece of cloth used to cover something
ötmək: to overtake (to pass a more slowly moving object or entity)
özbək: Uzbek (ethnic Uzbek person or person from Uzbekistan)
üzrlü: having a valid reason, having a valid cause
şillə: slap in the face, box on the ear
əkrəm: a male given name from Arabic
əksər: major (greater in number, quantity, or extent.)
əlaçı: honor student, A student (a high-achieving student)
əmlak: property, especially all property one possesses combined
ərəfə: the day or night before, usually used for holidays
əyləc: brake (device used to slow or stop a vehicle)
əymək: to bend, to curve, crook, bow, tilt
əzmək: to rumple, to crumple, to wrinkle, to fumble, to crease
əğyar: broken plural of qeyr (“other person; stranger; foe”)
əşrəf: a male given name from Arabic
